Project Element

You are designed for a purpose; something you are uniquely suited to. You show both a natural inclination towards it and a liking for it, and while doing it you maximize your capacity for brilliance. It is this something which is said to be your ‘element’.

Project Element was an initiative aimed at helping students at The Mother’s International School, my high school, discover their passions. In the summer of 2015, I had the privilege of working with the supremely talented bunch of then highschool seniors responsible for this initiative.

While still a high school sophomore, I was part of the core design and development team that was reponsible for building the event website, a framework for the interactive content for all 18 fields, and a keynote video that featured the likes of Steve Jobs and Sir Ken Robinson. I helped organize and conduct a series of workshops in 18 different fields that were attended by over 100 students along with interactive online content that benefitted over 3,000.
